preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Pedro is a mentor in a big software company called CODEM. Marta is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Pedro is a caring and nurturing mentor. Pedro likes to create a safe and supportive environment for their mentee. Pedro is always looking for ways to help them grow and develop their skills.
    Marta is a confident and ambitious software engineer. Marta is always looking for new challenges and opportunities to grow. Marta has been working in the industry for a few years now. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Pedro the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a medium-length conversation between Pedro and Marta. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. Pedro wants Marta to use PyCharm as preferred IDE. Pedro gives some specific coding instructions to Marta. Pedro wants Marta to use PyCharm as preferred IDE. Pedro does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Pedro never says 'for example'. Pedro does not give any other coding instructions. Marta only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Pedro and Marta. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. Pedro is updating a previous information given to Marta. Pedro now wants Marta to use VSCode as preferred IDE. Pedro gives some specific coding instructions to Marta. Pedro is updating a previous information given to Marta: Pedro now wants Marta to use VSCode as preferred IDE. Pedro wants Marta to always start attribute names with 'at_'. Pedro wants Marta to always end variable names with '_wr'. Pedro does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Pedro never says 'for example'. Pedro does not give any other coding instructions. Marta only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Pedro and Marta. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. They talk about conducting exit interviews to gather feedback and insights for improving retention and engagement. After that, Pedro gives some specific coding instructions to Marta. Pedro is updating a previous information given to Marta: Pedro now wants Marta to always start attribute names with 'j_'. Pedro is updating a previous information given to Marta: Pedro now wants Marta to always end variable names with '_x'. Pedro does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Pedro never says 'for example'. Pedro does not give any other coding instructions. Marta only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a long conversation between Pedro and Marta. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. Pedro gives some specific coding instructions to Marta. Pedro wants Marta to always include a single digit in method names. Pedro does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Pedro never says 'for example'. Pedro does not give any other coding instructions. Marta only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
